items.title: In Assault on Free Speech, Trump Targets Speech He Hates
items.summary: The president’s complaints about negative coverage undermine the rationales offered by his own officials.

items.title: Security Officials Are Treating Charlie Kirk’s Memorial Like a Super Bowl
items.summary: The authorities have approached security measures as an “all hands on deck” operation.

items.title: The W.N.B.A.’s Growing Fan-Base
items.summary: Boys and men now love women’s basketball, too.

items.title: For Erika Kirk, a Husband’s Life Cut Short by Violence He Seemed to Foresee
items.summary: In an interview, the wife of the conservative activist Charlie Kirk said she had implored him to wear a bulletproof vest. But she sees divine work in his death.

items.title: Charlie Kirk Memorial Draws an Outpouring From the Right
items.summary: President Trump, JD Vance and other high-profile guests are among the more than 100,000 people expected to attend the service at a football stadium and nearby arena near Phoenix on Sunday.

items.title: Charlie Kirk memorial begins as Trump and Vance expected among thousands of attendees - latest updates
items.summary: <p>US president en route to Glendale, Arizona, as number of far-right commentators including Steve Bannon and Lauren Boebert attend event </p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/sep/20/charlie-kirk-debate-style">Students who debated with Kirk: ‘His goal was to defeat us’</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/news/ng-interactive/2025/sep/21/us-right-free-speech-charlie-kirk">US right claimed free speech was sacred – until the Charlie Kirk killing</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>Christian nationalists in the US are positioning Charlie Kirk as a martyr for their movement, one that has grown in popularity and whose rise was intertwined with Kirk’s own political ascent.</strong></p><p>After Kirk’s killing, his widow, Erika Kirk, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/DOhq3UBEd6l/?hl=en&amp;img_index=6">wrote</a> on social media that the “world is evil”, but God “so good”. The “sound of this widow weeping [echoes] throughout this world like a battle cry,” she said. “They have no idea what they just ignited within this wife.”</p><p>“Last week, we brought my dear friend Charlie Kirk home one last time. Today, we return to Arizona to remember Charlie and honor his sacrifice. May he eternally rest in peace, and may God watch over Erika and their beautiful children.”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/21/charlie-kirk-funeral-memorial-time-updates-arizona">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: ‘Nothing stops reporters’: Trump talks down Pentagon restrictions on journalists
items.summary: <p>DoD previously said journalists would lose passes if they did not sign ‘pledge’ not to release certain information</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> appeared to talk down about Pentagon restrictions that aim to severely limit journalists’ abilities to report on US <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-military">military</a> issues.</p><p>The president faced questions about the directive as he departed the White House for <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/21/thousands-gather-at-charlie-kirk-memorial-in-arizona-where-trump-to-pay-tribute-to-slain-organizer">Charlie Kirk’s memorial service</a> on Sunday. Asked whether the Pentagon should be in charge of deciding what reporters can report on, Trump said: “No, I don’t think so.”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/21/trump-pentagon-journalists">Continue reading...</a>
